column2: P MOTOR 1

Color PC drum motor malfunction 
 • The color PC drum motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. 
 • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the color PC drum motor is being rotated.

1 Check the connector between M4-PRCB PJ12 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the M4 connector for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 M4 operation check PRCB PJ12-3 to 6 E-15 4 Change M4. 5 Change PRCB.
P MOTOR 2

Main motor malfunction 
 • The main motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. 
 • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the main motor is being rotated.

1 Check the connector between M2-PRCB PJ11 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the M2 connector for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 M2 operation check. 4 Change M2. 5 Change PRCB.
D MOTOR 2

Developing motor malfunction 
 • The developing motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. 
 • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the developing motor is being rotated

1 Check the connector between M1-PRCB PJ11 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the M1 connector for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 M1 operation check PRCB PJ11-3 to 6 B-15 4 Change M1. 5 Change PRCB.
DUPLEX FAN

Cooling fan motor malfunction 
 • The cooling fan motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. 
 • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the cooling fan motor is being rotated.

1 Check the connector between FM11-relay CN29-PRCB PJ10 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the fan for possible overload and correct as necessary. 3 FM11 operation check. 4 Change FM11. 5 Change PRCB.
POWER FAN

DC power supply fan motor malfunction
 • The DC power supply fan motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. 
 • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the DC power supply fan motor is being rotated.

1 Check the connector between FM10-relay CN43-PRCB PJ3 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the fan for possible overload and correct as necessary. 3 FM10 operation check. 4 Change FM10. 5 Change PRCB.
TRAY3 FEED MOT

Tray 3 media feed motor malfunction 
 • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the media feed motor is being rotated.

1 Check the connector between M1-PCCB PJ3 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the connector between PCCB PJ1, PJ2-relay CN53, CN70-PRCB PJ25 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the M1 connector for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 4 M1 operation check PCCB PJ3-4 to 8 K-2 5 Change M1. 6 Change PCCB. 7 Change PRCB.
XFER DETACH 2

2nd image transfer pressure / retraction failure 
 • The IDC sensor does not come into the condition where the level detection is available (retracted position = IDC sensor shutter is open) within a given period of time after the 2nd transfer release solenoid has turned ON. 
 • The IDC sensor does not come into the condition where the level detection is not available (pressed position = IDC sensor shutter is closed) within a given period of time after the 2nd transfer release solenoid has turned ON.

1 Check the connector between M2-PRCB PJ11 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the M2 connector for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 Check the connector between IDC-PRCB PJ19 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Check the connector between SD2-relay CN23-PRCB PJ24 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 5 IDC sensor check. 6 SD2 operation check. 7 M2 operation check. 8 Change SD2. 9 Change M2. 10 Change IDC. 11 Change PRCB.
XFER DETACH 1

1st image transfer pressure / retraction failure
 • The 1st transfer release sensor is not activated (retracted position) within a given period of time after the 1st transfer release solenoid has turned ON. 
 • The 1st transfer release sensor is not deactivated (pressed position) within a given period of time after the 1st transfer release solenoid has turned ON.

1 Check the connector between M2-PRCB PJ11 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the M2 connector for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 Check the connector between PS17-PRCB PJ26 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Check the connector between SD1-relay CN25-PRCB PJ13 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 5 PS17 sensor check. 6 SD1 operation check. 7 M2 operation check. 8 Change PS17. 9 Change SD1. 10 Change M2. 11 Change PRCB.
POLYGON MOT

Polygon motor malfunction
 • The polygon motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time after it has been started. 
 • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the polygon motor is being rotated.
1 Check the connector between PH unit- PRCB PJ18 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change PH unit. 3 Change PRCB.
LASER ERROR

Laser malfunction 
 • The SOS signal is not detected within a given period of time after the output of the laser has been started.

1 Check the connector between PH unit- PRCB PJ18 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the connector between PH unit- MFPB CN15 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change PH unit. 4 Change PRCB.
FUSER ERROR

Heating roller warm-up failure
 • The thermistor /1 does not detect the specified temperature and the warm-up cycle is not completed even after the lapse of a given period of time after the cycle has been started.

1 Check the fuser unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the connector between fuser unit- PRCB PJ9 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the connector between fuser unit- DCPU CN2 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Change fuser unit. 5 Change PRCB. 6 Change DCPU.
TERMISTOR1

Thermistor open-circuit failure 
 • The temperature detected by the thermistor/1 does not reach a predetermined level even after the lapse of a given period time after the warm-up cycle has been started.

1 Check the fuser unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the connector between fuser unit- PRCB PJ9 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the connector between fuser unit- DCPU CN2 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Change fuser unit. 5 Change PRCB. 6 Change DCPU.
TERMISTOR2

Thermistor resistance failure 
 • The difference between the temperature detected by thermistor/1 and that detected by thermistor/2 exceeds a predetermined value.

1 Check the fuser unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the connector between fuser unit- PRCB PJ9 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the connector between fuser unit- DCPU CN2 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Change fuser unit. 5 Change PRCB. 6 Change DCPU.
FUSER ERROR

Abnormally low heating roller temperature 
 • The temperature detected by the thermistor /1 remains lower than the specified value for a given period of time or longer.

1 Check the fuser unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the connector between fuser unit- PRCB PJ9 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the connector between fuser unit- DCPU CN2 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Change fuser unit. 5 Change PRCB. 6 Change DCPU.
FUSER ERROR

Abnormally high heating roller temperature 
 • The temperature detected by the thermistor /1 remains higher than the specified value for a given period of time or longer. • The heater lamp remains ON for a given period of time or longer.

1 Check the fuser unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the connector between fuser unit- PRCB PJ9 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the connector between fuser unit- DCPU CN2 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Change fuser unit. 5 Change PRCB. 6 Change DCPU.
TE SENSOR Y

Toner level sensor /Y malfunction 
 • An error occurs on the toner level sensor for each color.
1 Check the connector between each sensor- PRCB PJ21 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Replace the toner level sensor of the corresponding color. 3 Change PRCB.
TE SENSOR M

Toner level sensor /M malfunction 
 • An error occurs on the toner level sensor for each color.
1 Check the connector between each sensor- PRCB PJ21 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Replace the toner level sensor of the corresponding color. 3 Change PRCB.
TE SENSOR C

Toner level sensor /C malfunction 
 • An error occurs on the toner level sensor for each color.
1 Check the connector between each sensor- PRCB PJ21 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Replace the toner level sensor of the corresponding color. 3 Change PRCB.
TE SENSOR K

Toner level sensor /K malfunction 
 • An error occurs on the toner level sensor for each color.
1 Check the connector between each sensor- PRCB PJ21 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Replace the toner level sensor of the corresponding color. 3 Change PRCB.
13DD
EEPROM BK

Backup data error
 • The engine counter data and the controller counter data are inconsistent.
1 Select [SERVICE MENU] - [BK Clear], and execute the BK Clear function. 2 Check the connector between MFPB CN16-PRCB PJ5 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change PRCB. 4 Change MFPB.
FLASH WRITE

Flash ROM write error
 • Flash ROM writing is found faulty during a check.
1 Rewrite the engine firmware. 2 Change PRCB.
FLASH DEVICE

Flash ROM device fault
 • An erase error occurs during erasing of data in flash ROM
1 Rewrite the engine firmware. 2 Change PRCB.
ENGINE ERR

Engine control failure
 • An undefined malfunction occurs in the engine section (PRCB, etc.). While the machine is operating, if it detects defective conditions, e.g. the next print is not started after the lapse of a given period of time, it stops operating and the trouble code is displayed.
1 Reboot the main body.
EEPROM1

Trouble related to security 
 • Contact the responsible people of KONICA MINOLTA when not returning in power switch OFF/ON.
EEPROM2

Trouble related to security 
 • Contact the responsible people of KONICA MINOLTA when not returning in power switch OFF/ON.
RAM ERROR

RAM error at startup (standard memory)
 • RAM error at standard memory is detected during printer start-up.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check connection state of the standard/ expanded memory and correct as necessary. 3 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Change the standard/expanded memory. 5 Change MFPB.
RAM ERROR

RAM error at startup (expanded memory)
 • RAM error at expanded memory is detected during printer start-up.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check connection state of the standard/ expanded memory and correct as necessary. 3 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Change the standard/expanded memory. 5 Change MFPB.
H/W ADDRESS

MAC address error at startup
 • Invalid MAC address is detected during printer start-up.
1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change MFPB.
BOOT ROM

Boot ROM error at startup
 • Boot ROM error is detected during printer startup.
1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change MFPB.
CONTROLLER ROM

Controller ROM error (Configuration information error) 
 • Lead error of destination setting file is detected during the printer starting.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 If this error message is displayed after update of firmware, conduct the firmware update procedures again. 4 Change MFPB.
CONTROLLER ROM

Controller ROM error (Access error)
 • Flash ROM access error is detected during the printer starting.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 If this error message is displayed after update of firmware, conduct the firmware update procedures again. 4 Change MFPB.
CONTROLLER ROM

Controller ROM error (Data error)
 • Final check sum error is detected during the printer starting.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 If this error message is displayed after update of firmware, conduct the firmware update procedures again. 4 Change MFPB.
HDD ERROR

HDD access error
 • When correct access to the hard disk kit is failed during access.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the HDD connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Change HDD. 5 Change MFPB.
HDD DISK FULL

HDD full error
 • Range for user space is full during access to the hard disk kit.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Delete the job hold in [PROOF/PRINT MENU] to increase the available range for user space. 3 Check the HDD connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Format HDD with [SYS DEFAULT MENU]- [HDD FORMAT.] 5 Change HDD.
CARD ERROR

Compact flash access error
 • When correct access to the compact flash card is failed during access

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the compact flash for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Change compact flash. 5 Change MFPB.
CARD FULL

Compact flash full error
 • Range for user space is full during access to the compact flash card.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Delete the job hold in [PROOF/PRINT MENU] to increase the available range for user space. 3 Check the compact flash for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Format compact flash with [SYS DEFAULT MENU]-[CARD FORMAT.] 5 Change compact flash.
UPDATE ERROR

Firmware update error
 • Firmware update fails to complete correctly during update.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the cable that has been used for update of the firmware for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the firmware update file and if the file is not the correct one, update the firmware again. 4 Check the firmware update procedure and if the procedure is not correct, update the firmware again. 5 Update the firmware again. 6 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 7 Change MFPB.
FFFF
I/F COMM ERROR

Interface Communication error
 • Correct communication is failed when receiving/ sending the command between MFPB and PRCB.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary 3 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Change MFPB. 5 Change PRCB.
